Rationale and evidence
Pre-eclampsia is a hypertensive disorder that develops in approximately 5% of all pregnancies, 
usually after about 20 weeks gestation (190). In pre-eclampsia there are often problems with the 
placenta, along with increased blood pressure, that can reduce blood flow and therefore oxygen 
and nutrient supply to the baby. These conditions may result in intra-uterine growth retardation 
and possib
